Methods

GetValidIntInput(String)

Displays a message and recieves a used input which is converted to an integer Until a valid input is recieved:

  • Write the message to the console
  • Read user input and attempt to convert to integer
Declaration
public static int GetValidIntInput(string message)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String message

The message to output to the console
Returns
Type Description
System.Int32

The valid user supplied integer

GetValidIntInput(String, Int32, Int32)

Displays a message and recieves user input then varifies that the input is an integer within the INCLUSIVE range provided Until a valid input is recieved:

  • Write the message to the console
  • Read user input and attempt to convert to integer
  • When an integer is recieved, check that it is within the supplied range
Declaration
public static int GetValidIntInput(string message, int minValue, int maxValue)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String message

The message to output to the console
System.Int32 minValue

Minimum inclusive value of valid input
System.Int32 maxValue

Maximum inclusive value of valid input
Returns
Type Description
System.Int32

The valid user supplied integer

GetValidStringInput(String, Char[], Boolean)

Displays a message to the console then prompts user for input, checks input is contained within list of valid characters then converts the input to upper or lower case string Until a valid input is recieved:

  • Write the message to the console
  • Check if the message is contained in the valid word list
  • If valid, convert input to upper/lower case
Declaration
public static string GetValidStringInput(string message, char[] validWords, bool upper)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String message

The message to write to the console
System.Char[] validWords

A list of valid user inputs
System.Boolean upper

True to return upper case, false to return lower case
Returns
Type Description
System.String

The valid user supplied string converted to upper or lower case

GetValidStringInput(String, String[])

Displays a message to the console then prompts user for input, checks input is contained within list of valid words Until a valid input is recieved:

  • Write the message to the console
  • Check if the message is contained in the valid word list
